message:
I am used to debian on servers and desktop,

I changed my host to Amazon EC2, I have a question

Anyone used Amazon Linux ?  what it's like ? I heard it's based on redhat does the tutorials apply if I am stuck ?

Amazon Linux or Ubuntu ?

data.message: As far as I remember it was really easy to use, I never got stuck with something.

Why not let an Amazonian answer you?
KarimAllah Ahmed

I installed ubuntu at the end of the day but I think it's kinda lighter than Ubuntu that comes with Digitalocean
top was really tiny =D

Well, with Amazon EC2 you have plenty of Linux-based images that you can run for your instance. Some of the instances will be very basic and so light and you can find others that are pre-configured for if you are going to use it for web development for example. You can search for those pre-configured machines using this term "Amazon AMI" + You can make your instance that you configured yourself an AMI machine that people would use too.

Amazon have many Linux-distributions to use such as CentOS, Open Suse, Ubuntu & Redhat =)
If it based on Red Hat, any thing for CentOS will be fine (Configurations, tutorials ... etc, and centos has very big community)

ana dyman b-setup ubuntu lma b-create new instance grabt marra amazon linux bs m3rftsh a3ml ay 7aga m3aha msh fahmlaha akteblaha commands eih w mfeesh wla command mn ay distro a3rafaha redy ysht3'al and i got stuck too :D
I  like Debian, nice stable, easy, great community and never got stuck with it where I couldn't fix something
it's Redhat Based, go for centos tutorials
